subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Where's everyone gone?
msgSnippet: On Mon, Jun 24, 2002 at 01:27:19PM -0400, C. Paige Gabhart wrote: Josh Cogliati wrote: On Mon, Jun 24, 2002 at 10:19:05AM +0100, Michael Fitzgerald ... An
messageBody:
On Mon, Jun 24, 2002 at 01:27:19PM -0400, C. Paige Gabhart wrote:
Josh Cogliati wrote:

On Mon, Jun 24, 2002 at 10:19:05AM +0100, Michael Fitzgerald
wrote:
> Hi Paige,
>
> >I believe I have to get some
> > type of program to
> > permit Linux to work with the truetype fonts.
An alternative is to use pfaedit to convert the truetype font
to a pfa font.

Josh:

I am using RedHat Linux and Netscape to access the net. If I want to
type in QS, I can use the Jerome font which is a truetype font, but
this doesn't work in Linux. So if I convert the font to a pfa, this
should work? Where do I get pfaedit? Thanks for the help. Also
thanks to Michael for his response to my query.
You can get http://pfaedit.sourceforge.net/
You will then need to open up the ttf file in pfaedit generate a new
font that is type .pfb. Then move the .pfb and the .afm to something
like /usr/X11R6/lib/X11/fonts/Type1 and add a line like:
Ghoti.pfb -unknown-ghoti-medium-r-normal--0-0-0-0-p-0-iso10646-1
to the fonts.scale file and rerun mkfontdir in that directory.

I can definitly post the .pfb/.afm pairs if someone can tell me if the
copyright on jerome.ttf and ghoti.ttf will allow this. (Does it allow
modification and redistribution?)

Paige

>Josh Cogliati
jjc@...

On Mon, Jun 24, 2002 at 01:27:19PM -0400, C. Paige Gabhart wrote:
   Josh Cogliati wrote:
   
      On Mon, Jun 24, 2002 at 10:19:05AM +0100, Michael Fitzgerald
     wrote:
     > Hi Paige,
     >
     > >I believe I have to get some
     > > type of program to
     > > permit Linux to work with the truetype fonts.
     An alternative is to use pfaedit to convert the truetype font
     to a pfa font.
     
   Josh:
   
   I am using RedHat Linux and Netscape to access the net.  If I want to
   type in QS, I can use the Jerome font which is a truetype font, but
   this doesn't work in Linux.  So if I convert the font to a pfa, this
   should work?  Where do I get pfaedit?  Thanks for the help.  Also
   thanks to Michael for his response to my query.
You can get http://pfaedit.sourceforge.net/
You will then need to open up the ttf file in pfaedit generate a new 
font that is type .pfb.  Then move the .pfb and the .afm to something 
like /usr/X11R6/lib/X11/fonts/Type1 and add a line like:
Ghoti.pfb    -unknown-ghoti-medium-r-normal--0-0-0-0-p-0-iso10646-1
to the fonts.scale file and rerun mkfontdir in that directory.

I can definitly post the .pfb/.afm pairs if someone can tell me if the 
copyright on jerome.ttf and ghoti.ttf will allow this.  (Does it allow
modification and redistribution?)
   
   Paige
